content: this text is about a legal procedure called statement liquidation distribution cost procedure that lasted for 10 months and 11 days the total cost of the procedure was €15000 mrs vd is ordered to pay mr c a sum of €15091718 additionally mrs vd must pay notary vl €1503595 and mr c must pay notary vl €910595 totaling €2414190 mrs vd is also required to transfer €16595313 to notary vl and mr c is to transfer €14181123 to the undersigned notary the text explains the preliminary procedure the composition of assets claims made by both parties and the division of financial accounts mr c is entitled to various claims including reimbursement for mortgage repayments and property tax while ms vd is entitled to claims for housing allowance fire insurance and repair costs the text concludes with the allocation of the settlement and the approval of the court the notary reminds the parties involved to review a document called a bailiffs writ which has been sent to them by registered mail they have one month to raise any objections or concerns a drawing of lots will take place in the absence or presence of the parties involved and any disputes or difficulties will be documented if the parties agree to the statement it becomes final and may be approved by a competent court once approved the joint ownership between the parties ceases and they no longer have any claims or rights the notary also mentions a fee of fifty euros for the statement drawn
